statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola 76, Fairfield 72
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Gerald Brown scored a team-high 20 points as Loyola of Maryland rallied to defeat Fairfield 76-72 in Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference quarterfinal action Saturday night at the Arena at Harbor Yard. Loyola (18-12) will play Niagara, a 77-52 winner over Rider, in the semifinals Sunday. The Greyhounds used a game-breaking 10-0 run to erase a 66-61 Fairfield lead with 5:26 left. Brown and Josko Alujevic each hit 3-pointers in the run to give Loyola a 71-66 lead with 2:33 to play. Michael Van Schaick scored 20 of his 24 points in the second half for Fairfield (13-19). He scored 10 points in a seven-minute stretch that gave the Stags a 62-56 lead with 7:57 left. Greg Nero scored 15 and Anthony Johnson had 13 for Fairfield. Marquis Sullivan scored 16, Alujevic added 14 and Omari Isreal had 13 for Loyola. Loyola coach Jimmy Patsos and Fairfield coach Ed Cooley got into a heated verbal exchange while standing next to the officials at midcourt with 16:47 left after the Greyhounds' Shane James fouled Anthony Johnson under the Fairfield basket. The coaches shook hands at the end of the game. Loyola had taken a 34-33 halftime lead thanks to a 3-pointer by Isreal with 7.8 seconds left.
